channel.title: Cpu fans?
channel.description:
Cpu fans? Hi all. I decided to rebuild my server machine (intel stl2 2U).
The main thing I wanted to change was the volume, so I ripped out the two 10/15k rpm 18.2gb drives and replaced with one quiet 40gb 7200 rpm drive. After that, I disconnected two fans (hdd caddy/ram) then I installed ubuntu server (will replace with debian or other better server OS as ubuntu pisses me off with its restrictions). After that, I added another 512mb ram to make it 1.25gb and removed the two fans from the cpus. It idles at around 35-40C without the fans, and when I locked it at 100% for 5 mins it went up to 50-55C on each cpu. [b]At these temperatures, would it be recommended to put fans back on, or leave it silent?[/b]
Also, would anyone like to donate a pci IDE card?

item.title: Cpu fans?
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:28, topic:281050”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=371148.msg2808145#msg2808145 date=1243834853]
According to the guys who made the aqaurium pc (submerged in mineral oil to look like water) - a pretty long time. They’ve had theirs running for like a year+ iirc, and no sign of damage yet.
[/quote]

Looks like my next build is gonna be an aquarium pc then. They even sell DIY kits but their a bit expensive at 237$ X.X[/quote]

Laser cut an acrylic case (School?) with 5mm+ acrylic. MAKE SURE IT’S GLUED WELL! and add oil.

I use the stock Intel Q6600 fan…

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu fans?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:18, topic:281050”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=371148.msg2804433#msg2804433 date=1243639551]

What if I get a DoS attack or something which locks my cpus at 100% for a few hours? Wouldn’t there be a risk of my house burning down?

CPU damage starts at around 70-80C.
[/quote]
What with GPU, my is sometimes 89C, does that give damage?[/quote]
GPU’s can sustain higher temps. If I recall correctly, 95C is max.

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu fans?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:17, topic:281050”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=371148.msg2804960#msg2804960 date=1243673743]
I just looked that server up and iirc it supports Dual Pentium III CPU 133FSB 667 MHz to 1 GHz so guess that thats the cpu you have. If you have a 1Ghz P3, the maximum operating temperature is around 60-70°C depending on how old it is. (The old ones break at lower temperatures). Its better than my 3Ghz P4 which idles at around 50-50°C!

xEnt, neally all Intel CPUs have heat management software which does shutdown the computer if it exceeds operating temperatures however many AMD CPU’s dont and they will keep going until they fry. I have seen one explode out of its socket!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xf0VuRG7MN4
[/quote]

Those are all old cpus Im pretty sure you can’t claim AMD doesn’t have heat mangement now. And the magic smoke escaping is nothing…I seen a video where some1 overclocked a cpu waaay too high then removed the heatsink and it literally blew a square hole into the motherboard, and through the table it was on.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xG0sGugsv28[/quote]

Lol thats clearly a fake, the bad acting would prove it if nothing else…

Read full topic

Who cares about noise? My desktop sounds like a jet taking off, I love it.

Then you’ll love my computer, Its has a Prescott!

When you boot the computer its louder than a hair dryer on full blast! Unfortunately, my computer manufacture replaced the stock Pentium 4 fan with some terrible budget one of their own and it makes the loudest noises ever.
When idling it runs at around 1600-1900RPM but still doesn’t keep my CPU cool.
